p: As in Study 1, both assignment to the medical analogy condition and liberal ideology were associated with perceived helpfulness of the passage in thinking about climate change (MA: b = 0.69, t(188) = 4.21, p < .001, sr 2 = .09; Ideology: b = 0.19, t(187) = 2.59, p < .01, sr 2 = .03). Also replicating Study 1, the interaction was not significant.
